      The user-name for the database If this was for real, we would read in from a configuration file, but we are constrained to no file I/O for this project.

      • user

        java.lang.String user
        The user-name for the database If this was for real, we would read in from a configuration file, but we are constrained to no file I/O for this project.

      • pass

        java.lang.String pass
        The password for the database. If this was for real, we would read in from a configuration file, but we are constrained to no file I/O for this project.

      • createAccount

        public Account createAccount(java.lang.String firstName,
                    java.lang.String middleName,
                    java.lang.String lastName,
                    java.lang.String address1,
                    java.lang.String address2,
                    java.lang.String city,
                    java.lang.String state,
                    java.lang.String zipCode,
                    java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
        Creates an account in the database
        Parameters:
        firstName - The person's first name
        middleName - The person's middle name
        lastName - The person's last name
        address1 - The first part of the person's address
        address2 - The second part of the person's address
        city - The person's city
        state - The person's state
        zipCode - The person's zip code
        username - The username
        password - The password
        Returns:
        The created Account
